title: Calculus
description: Fundamentals of analysis with detailed explanations and examples.

Analysis is a central field of mathematics that deals with limits, continuous functions, differentiation, and integration. It forms the mathematical foundation for understanding changes and continuous processes.

Main Topics of Analysis:

1. Sequences and Series

Fundamental concepts of analysis.

  • Convergence and Divergence
  • Monotonicity and Boundedness
  • Series Criteria

2. Limits

Fundamental concept for continuity and differentiability.

  • Limits of Functions
  • Continuity
  • Intermediate Value Theorem

3. Differential Calculus

Investigation of local properties of functions.

  • Derivative Rules
  • Extrema
  • Curve Sketching

4. Integral Calculus

Calculation of areas and volumes.

  • Riemann Integral
  • Antiderivatives
  • Integration Rules

5. Multidimensional Analysis

Extension to functions of several variables.

  • Partial Derivatives
  • Multiple Integrals
  • Vector Analysis

Applications

Physics

  • Equations of Motion
  • Heat Conduction
  • Electrodynamics

Economics

  • Optimization
  • Growth Models
  • Cost Analysis

Engineering

  • Control Systems
  • Signal Processing
  • Fluid Mechanics
